ApproxsimClient.object
Class ApproxsimObject

java.lang.Object
  ApproxsimClient.object.ApproxsimObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
Transferable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Curve, Point, Shape, ApproxsimList, ApproxsimSimple
public abstract class ApproxsimObject
extends Object
implements Transferable

ApproxsimObject is the common origin of the objects handled by the ApproxsimClient. The tree-handling methods of this class acts like a leaf-node.

getDeclaration

public Declaration getDeclaration()
Returns the declaration specifying this object, or null if no such can be specified (e. g. if this object has no parent). Note that the type of the returned declaration may be a superclass of the actual type the object has.

getReference

public Reference getReference()
Returns a Reference to this object

getChild

public ApproxsimObject getChild(int index)
Returns the child at the specified index assuming the child is enumerated by the objects type. Note that this means that getChild(j) may return null while getChild(i) and getChild(k) does not for i < j < k.

Parameters:
index - the index of the object.

getChild

public ApproxsimObject getChild(String identifier)
Returns the child at the specified index assuming the child is enumerated by the objects type. Note that this means that getChild(j) may return null while getChild(i) and getChild(k) does not for i < j < k.

Parameters:
identifier - the identifier of the child to get.

add

public void add(ApproxsimObject part,
                Object initiator)
Adds a new child object to this object. If child with identical identifier exists, the previous entry is removed.

Parameters:
part - the ApproxsimObject to add.
initiator - The initiator of the add.

add

public void add(Vector parts)
Adds all children in provided vector to this object. If any child with identical identifier already exists, the previous entry is removed.

author Daniel Ahlin

Parameters:
parts - the ApproxsimObjects to add.

setParent

protected abstract void setParent(ApproxsimObject parent)
Sets the parent of this object. Note that implementations of this method have to make sure to call ApproxsimObjectFactory.attached iff getParent()==null when this function is called with a non-null argument.

Parameters:
parent - the new parent of this object.

getTag

public String getTag()
Returns the tag of this object (used for XML representation). For some objects this will be the same as the identifier. However for nonsingular objects it will be the tag of the list holding them.
